Name: bentonite quarry operation | bentonite | EN15804GD, U
Category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Description: The technology used in the modelled German mine is probably state-of-art (first mining company in Europe taking part at an eco-audit based on EG-eco-audit requirements). The assumed thickness of the bentonite layer is 3 m. The thickness of overburden material is estimated to be 30 m. Digging and transportation is made by heavy diesel machines.;Reference:;Kellenberger D., Althaus H.-J., Jungbluth N., Künniger T., Lehmann M. and Thalmann P. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Building Products. Final report ecoinvent Data v2.0 No. 7. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.
Tags: Sector: Resource Extraction; Minerals; Cement & Concrete
